success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant reschedules the 'Cotton Insect Monitoring Run-Through' toolbox meeting from 2026-01-20 to a suitable slot on or near 2026-01-22 in the late afternoon, keeping the same attendees and location, via update_meeting.

task.objective: Reschedule the cotton insect monitoring toolbox meeting

injected_behaviors.instructions: Andrew has a pre-season cotton insect monitoring run-through with his agronomist and a couple of neighbouring growers that clashes with a junior cricket coaching session. He wants it moved from the original date to later that same week, preferably late afternoon so everyone can still get their morning jobs done. He’s happy to be flexible by a day either side of the preferred date if needed, but doesn’t want it to run past 6 pm because of family commitments.

existing_meeting.title: Cotton Insect Monitoring Run-Through
existing_meeting.location: Watson Family Farm Shed, Boggabri NSW

persona.name: Andrew Watson
persona.bio: Andrew Watson runs a mixed cotton and grain operation just outside Boggabri, where he’s spent the last decade reshaping his family farm around native shelterbelts, beneficial insects, and bird and bat habitat instead of relying on heavy chemical use. He’s data‑driven but down‑to‑earth, tracking everything from spray savings to bird counts, and he enjoys swapping notes with other growers over a cuppa or at field days. When he’s not in the header or checking soil moisture, he’s usually coaching junior cricket or tinkering with old farm machinery in the shed.
persona.writing_style: Plainspoken Australian rural, friendly and practical, mostly full sentences, occasional farm jargon, straightforward and to the point
sample_messages: G’day, just touching base to confirm you’ve got the latest insect count sheets before Thursday’s walk-through?
We’ve noticed a big drop in heliothis since we widened the tree belts and backed off the broad-spectrum sprays. Happy to share the numbers if that’s useful for your trial work.
Can we line up a time next week to talk through options for monitoring more bat activity over the western block? Evenings are best once I’m out of the paddock.

messages.output_raw: G’day. I need to shift a cotton insect monitoring toolbox meeting I’ve got booked – it’s clashing with junior cricket. Can you help me reschedule it to later that same week?

steps.output_raw:
<think>
Need meeting identified and preferences. Ask details. </think>
<plan>
1. Ask for details about the existing meeting so I can locate it.
2. Ask about preferred days/times later in the same week and key attendees.
3. Once clarified, search for common free slots using the availability tools.
4. Propose one or two options, then reschedule the meeting with update_meeting.
5. Confirm the new time with the user.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I can help with that.

To reschedule it, I need a few details:
1) What day and time is the cotton insect monitoring toolbox meeting currently booked for?  
2) Roughly what dates make up “that same week” for you (e.g., week of 9 Dec), and which days/times later in the week are OK?  
3) Who needs to be included?  
   - If it’s already on your calendar, you can either:
     • Tell me the exact meeting title and date, or  
     • Give me the event ID if your calendar shows one.

Once I’ve got that, I’ll look for a suitable slot later in the week and move the meeting there.</action>

action_structured.text:

     • Give me the event ID if your calendar shows one.

Once I’ve got that, I’ll look for a suitable slot later in the week and move the meeting there.

messages.output_raw:
Yep, no worries.

1) It’s currently locked in for 20 January 2026.  
2) Ideally I’d like to move it to 22 January 2026, late arvo.  
3) It’s titled “Cotton Insect Monitoring Run-Through”.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
Need attendees and availability late arvo Jan 22; first I called find_meeting to get event_id and attendees. Now wait tool result then find slots or directly update if no conflicts. </think>
<plan>
1. Review the located meeting details including attendees and exact time.
2. Check availability for those attendees on 22 January 2026 in the late afternoon.
3. Pick a suitable time window and reschedule the meeting with update_meeting.
4. Confirm the new time back to the user or ask for alternatives if there’s no free slot.
</plan>
